data.title: Water temperature in Santa Cruz De Tenerife in Atlantic Ocean now
data.meta_description: What is the current water temperature in Santa Cruz De Tenerife in Atlantic Ocean? How the water temperature will change in Santa Cruz De Tenerife in the coming days. Statistics for recent years.
data.text:
Spain > Canary Islands

Santa Cruz De Tenerife

Sea water temperature in Santa Cruz De Tenerife today

Santa Cruz De Tenerife, Spain | © siesta.life

The most detailed information about the water temperature in Santa Cruz De Tenerife in Atlantic Ocean (Canary Islands, Spain). Forecast of changes in water temperature for the next 10 days. Statistics by months for recent years. Information about the neighboring resorts. Weather forecast in Santa Cruz De Tenerife for a week.

Water temperature in Santa Cruz De Tenerife right now

data updated 45 minutes ago

21.9°C

yesterday: 22.2°C

a week ago: 22.4°C

Trend: stability

Today water temperature in Santa Cruz De Tenerife is 21.9°C. This water is cool and invigorating, but for many people it is already comfortable enough for swimming. In general, this temperature is considered normal, but if your circulation is impaired, the water may still feel cool. In any case, the general weather is also important. So, the air temperature at the same time will reach 27°C.

Analysis and forecast

The water temperature today is slightly lower than the average on this day in recent years. Exactly a year ago, on this day, the water temperature in this location was 23°C. Water temperature range in Santa Cruz De Tenerife in August is from 21 to 25 degrees.

According to our forecast, the water temperature in Santa Cruz De Tenerife will move in different directions, in the coming days the water will become warmer, but after 10 days it will still get a little colder to 21.6°C.

* Fact - Actual value of water temperature

** Average - Average water temperature on this day in past years

*** Forecast - Our forecast for the water temperature

Actual nearshore temperatures may vary by several degrees from the indicated values. This is noticeable after heavy rain or after prolonged periods of strong winds. Some downstream winds cause cold, deep waters to replace surface waters that have been warmed by the sun.

To develop a forecast, we use our own mathematical model, which takes into account the current change in water temperature, historical data and the main weather trends, wind strength and direction, air temperature in each specific region. We also take into account data for other resorts in Spain.

Puerto de Mogan, Spain | © Robert Sluzalec

Annual graph of average water temperature change in Santa Cruz De Tenerife

Water temperature in Santa Cruz De Tenerife by month

Santa Cruz De Tenerife located in the northern hemisphere, at latitude 28 degrees. The comfortable water temperature for swimming is set here in January, usually at the beginning of the month. During a year in Santa Cruz De Tenerife there are 231 days of swimming. In general, the swimming season ends In December. Average annual water temperature on the coast in Santa Cruz De Tenerife is 21.1°C, by the seasons: in winter 19.8°C, in spring 19.5°C, in summer 22.1°C, in autumn 23.0°C. Minimum water temperature (18.3°C) in Santa Cruz De Tenerife it happens in April, maximum (24.3°C) in October.

You can find out detailed data on how the water temperature in Santa Cruz De Tenerife changes in each specific month:

The warmest water today in Spain recorded in Casablanca, its value is 28.8°C. Lowest - in A Guarda, there water temperature now 16.1°C. Average water temperature in the country today - 23.7°C.

Water temperature data in Santa Cruz De Tenerife and neighboring towns and resorts collected from various sources, using buoys, using satellite maps of sea, river and lake surfaces of the NOAA agency.

We use data from various local authorities in each specific location of the world to more accurately reflect temperature values.

The nearest airport is located in a 8 kilometers. This is Tenerife Norte (TFN) airport. We have no information as to whether it is valid and what flights it receives or sends.

Find out the temperature of sea water in more than 12000 cities and resorts around the world. Water surface temperature values are available in real time. There is a forecast of water temperature changes for the next few days, as well as historical data of sea surface temperature are available for all days of the last years.

We use data from various sources, including National Centers for Environmental Information (NOAA), meteorological services of different countries, data received from more than a thousand buoys around the world, satellite systems for scanning the surface of the oceans and seas.
